intro: Lappula columbiana, commonly known as the Columbia lappula, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It has a short life cycle and is adapted to thrive in harsh environmental conditions. The seeds are dispersed by wind, allowing the plant to colonize new areas efficiently.
